title: LSU jumps three spots to No. 3 in Amway Coaches Poll after defeat of Florida, while Georgia falls
text:
CLOSE

The first top-five upset of the college football season shook up the Amway Coaches Poll, setting up what figures to be a very interesting second half of the campaign. Alabama and Clemson continue to hold down the top two positions, but they now have company from two other teams getting No. 1 consideration.

The Crimson Tide claimed 44 of 65 first-place votes after another impressive win at Texas A&M. No. 2 Clemson, a big winner against Florida State, received 14 firsts.

LSU vaulted from the sixth spot all the way to the No. 3 position vacated by Georgia. The Tigers, who outlasted Florida in a prime-time thriller, received three first-place nods and edged just a single poll point ahead of No. 4 Ohio State, The Buckeyes, who had the weekend off, received the remaining four firsts. Oklahoma, which handled Texas in the Red River showdown, stayed put at No. 5.

Oct 12, 2019; Baton Rouge, LA, USA; LSU Tigers head coach Ed Orgeron along with wide receiver Justin Jefferson (2) and teammates celebrate following a win against the Florida Gators at Tiger Stadium. Mandatory Credit: Derick E. Hingle-USA TODAY Sports (Photo: Derick E. Hingle, Derick E. Hingle-USA TODAY Sports)

A couple of other unbeaten Big Ten challengers moved up as Wisconsin and Penn State grab the No. 6 and No. 7 spots, respectively. Notre Dame is back up to No. 8 followed by Florida. Georgia, which suffered a stunning upset at home to unranked South Carolina, tumbled from third to No. 10.

TOP 25: Complete Amway Coaches Poll rankings

WINNERS AND LOSERS: Highs and lows from Week 7 in college football

FOOTBALL FOUR: LSU shakes up College Football Playoff chase after win

Four teams join or reenter the Top 25 this week, headed by No. 21 Cincinnati. The Bearcats make their first poll appearance of the season after topping the list of others receiving votes last week.

No. 24 Appalachian State makes its first-ever Top 25 appearance since moving up to the Football Bowl Subdivision. No. 23 Washington is also back in, and No. 25 Temple picks up its first ranking since 2016.

Wake Forest, Virginia, Memphis and Texas A&M fell out after losses.
description: LSU moved up three spots to No. 3 in the Amway Coaches Poll behind Alabama and Clemson. Georgia dropped seven spots after losing to South Carolina.
